intro: Lachenalia reflexa, commonly known as the reflexed lachenalia, is a species of flowering plant in the Amaryllidaceae family. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it grows in rocky, well-drained soils. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces clusters of bell-shaped, tubular flowers in shades of yellow to orange. It is typically found in coastal and mountainous regions, thriving in full sun. Lachenalia reflexa is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to grow in suitable conditions.
